title: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald that explores themes of wealth, love, and the corruption of the American Dream.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel by Harper Lee that deals with racial injustice and the loss of innocence in a small town in Alabama during the 1930s.
A dystopian novel by George Orwell that portrays a totalitarian society and explores themes of government oppression, censorship, and individual freedom.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A classic romance novel by Jane Austen that follows the lives of the Bennet sisters and their pursuit of love and marriage in 19th century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A coming-of-age novel by J.D. Salinger that follows the disillusioned teenage protagonist, Holden Caulfield, as he wanders the streets of New York City.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: A novel by Gabriel Garcia Marquez that follows the Buendia family over several generations in the fictional town of Macondo, exploring themes of magic realism, time, and memory.

title: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien that follows the adventures of hobbit Bilbo Baggins as he helps a group of dwarves reclaim their treasure from the dragon Smaug.

title: Brave New World
description: A dystopian novel by Aldous Huxley that depicts a future society in which people are genetically engineered, conditioned, and medicated to be content with their roles in a rigidly stratified caste system.

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: A high fantasy trilogy by J.R.R. Tolkien that follows hobbit Frodo Baggins as he journeys to Mount Doom to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

title: The Color Purple
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel by Alice Walker that tells the story of Celie, an African-American woman in the early 20th century who overcomes abuse and oppression to find her voice and her place in the world.

title: Moby-Dick
description: A novel by Herman Melville that follows the obsessed Captain Ahab and his crew on their hunt for the great white whale, exploring themes of revenge, fate, and the human condition.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: A dystopian novel by Margaret Atwood that depicts a future society in which women are oppressed and used as reproductive vessels, following the story of Offred, a handmaid who rebels against the system.
